content: Yes, many streaming services have adopted the "binge-watch" model, which means they release an entire season or series at once, allowing viewers to watch the entire series over a weekend or whenever they have free time. This is very different from traditional TV networks, which release episodes on a weekly basis, meaning viewers have to wait a week or more to see the next episode. With the binge-watch model, viewers can enjoy uninterrupted viewing, and they are free to watch the entire series at their own pace while avoiding the frustration of waiting for the next episode to be aired. This model gives viewers greater control over their viewing experience, which has been a significant factor in the growth of streaming services.
